destinations.name: BIHAR
destinations.description: Bodh Gaya, Nalanda University ( Oldest University of the World ), An ancient city, Madhubani in Bihar is known for the richness in art and culture , Valmiki National Park

happeningEvents.description: Chhath is an ancient Hindu festival native to the Indian subcontinent, more specifically, the Indian states of Bihar.
Durga Puja is a huge celebration in Bihar .

destinations.name: Taj Mahal
destinations.description: The Taj Mahal, an iconic ivory-white marble mausoleum, is one of the Seven Wonders of the World. It was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal.

happeningEvents.description: A 10-day cultural festival showcasing arts, crafts, music, dance, and cuisine.
Diwali, the Festival of Lights, is celebrated with fireworks and cultural performances.

destinations.name: Goa Beaches
destinations.description: Goa, known for its picturesque beaches, is a popular beach destination in India. Visitors can enjoy golden sands, water sports, vibrant nightlife, and delicious seafood.
travelTips: Beware of strong currents while swimming.

happeningEvents.description: One of Asia's biggest electronic dance music festivals held on the beaches of Goa.
A lively, colorful event featuring parades, music, and dancing.

destinations.name: Kerala Backwaters
destinations.description: Kerala's backwaters are a network of serene waterways, lagoons, and lakes. Travelers can enjoy houseboat rides, lush green landscapes, and experience the unique coastal lifestyle.

happeningEvents.description: An annual snake boat race held in the Punnamada Lake in Alleppey.
A grand temple festival featuring a colorful procession of elephants and traditional music.

destinations.name: Varanasi
destinations.description: Varanasi, one of the oldest cities in the world, is a spiritual hub in India. It is famous for its ghats on the Ganges River, religious rituals, temples, and vibrant cultural heritage.
travelTips: Explore narrow alleys for hidden temples.

happeningEvents.description: A major Hindu festival dedicated to Lord Shiva, celebrated with fasting and night-long vigils.
The 'Festival of Lights of the Gods,' celebrated with illuminated ghats and cultural performances.

destinations.name: Jaipur
destinations.description: Jaipur, the capital city of Rajasthan, is known as the Pink City due to its distinctive pink-colored buildings. It boasts magnificent forts, palaces, museums, and a rich Rajasthani culture.

happeningEvents.description: The world's largest free literary festival featuring renowned authors, thinkers, and cultural performances.
A colorful and important festival dedicated to Goddess Gauri, marked by processions and cultural events.

destinations.name: Rishikesh
destinations.description: Rishikesh, situated in the foothills of the Himalayas, is a hub for adventure seekers and spiritual enthusiasts. Known for its yoga and meditation centers, it offers thrilling activities like white-water rafting and trekking.

happeningEvents.description: A week-long festival attracting yogis and spiritual leaders from around the world.
A festival celebrating the descent of the Ganges to Earth, marked by religious ceremonies and rituals.

destinations.name: Andaman Islands
destinations.description: The Andaman Islands, a tropical paradise in the Bay of Bengal, boast pristine beaches, vibrant coral reefs, and a rich marine life. Perfect for beach lovers and water sports enthusiasts.
travelTips: Obtain necessary permits for island visits.

happeningEvents.description: A celebration showcasing the cultural diversity of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
A festival commemorating the birth anniversary of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose, with cultural programs and exhibitions.

destinations.name: Udaipur
destinations.description: Udaipur, the 'City of Lakes,' is known for its majestic palaces, serene lakes, and vibrant markets. It offers a glimpse into Rajasthan's royal history and architectural marvels.
travelTips: Attend a traditional Rajasthani dance performance.

happeningEvents.description: A festival celebrating the arrival of spring with cultural events, processions, and performances.
Diwali festivities with illuminated palaces, cultural performances, and fireworks.

destinations.name: Darjeeling
destinations.description: Darjeeling, nestled in the Himalayan foothills, is a charming hill station known for its tea plantations, scenic landscapes, and the iconic Darjeeling Himalayan Railway.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: April to June and September to November
travelTips: Witness the sunrise at Tiger Hill.

happeningEvents.description: A winter carnival featuring cultural events, parades, and local performances.
Tibetan New Year celebrations with traditional dances, rituals, and cultural programs.

destinations.name: Ajanta and Ellora Caves
destinations.description: The Ajanta and Ellora Caves are a UNESCO World Heritage Site, featuring ancient rock-cut caves with exquisite sculptures, paintings, and architecture. These caves showcase the rich cultural and artistic heritage of ancient India.
popularActivities: Learning about ancient Indian art and history
travelTips: Wear comfortable shoes for cave exploration.
Engage a local guide for a better understanding of the historical significance.
Respect the cultural and religious sites.

happeningEvents.description: A cultural festival featuring classical music and dance performances, celebrating the artistic heritage of the region.
The vibrant and grand celebration of Lord Ganesha's festival with processions, music, and decorations.

destinations.name: Mumbai
destinations.description: Mumbai, the financial and entertainment capital of India, is a bustling metropolis known for its diverse culture, iconic landmarks, Bollywood film industry, and vibrant nightlife.
nearbyAttractions: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya (formerly Prince of Wales Museum)
travelTips: Try vada pav and pav bhaji, Mumbai's famous street food.
Visit the Elephanta Caves for a historical excursion.

happeningEvents.description: A nine-day-long celebration of arts, crafts, music, dance, and theatre, transforming the Kala Ghoda area into a cultural hub.
The grand procession and immersion of Lord Ganesha idols in the Arabian Sea, marking the end of Ganesh Chaturthi festival.

destinations.name: Kolkata
destinations.description: Kolkata, the cultural capital of India, is known for its rich history, artistic heritage, intellectual pursuits, and delectable cuisine. It's a city of joy with a blend of tradition and modernity.
popularActivities: Indulging in street food at Park Street
travelTips: Participate in local festivals and cultural events.
Try sweets like Rasgulla and Sandesh.
Explore the city's literary heritage at College Street.

happeningEvents.description: The grand celebration of Goddess Durga with artistic pandals, cultural performances, and religious rituals.
A prestigious film festival showcasing acclaimed movies and hosting renowned filmmakers from across the globe.

destinations.name: Puri
destinations.description: Puri, located on the Bay of Bengal, is a sacred city for Hindus and a popular beach destination. It is famous for the Jagannath Temple, pristine beaches, and the annual Rath Yatra festival.
travelTips: Respect the religious customs and traditions.
Enjoy sunrise and sunset at Puri Beach.

happeningEvents.description: The grand chariot festival of Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra, and Subhadra, where deities are taken on a procession in elaborately decorated chariots.
A celebration of classical dance forms against the backdrop of the magnificent Sun Temple, showcasing India's rich cultural heritage.

destinations.name: Shimla
destinations.description: Shimla, the capital city of Himachal Pradesh, is a charming hill station nestled in the Himalayas. It is known for its scenic beauty, colonial architecture, and pleasant weather, making it a popular destination for nature lovers and adventure enthusiasts.
destinations.bestTimeToVisit: March to June and September to November
travelTips: Pack warm clothing, even in summer.
Try local Himachali cuisine like Sidu and Babru.
Enjoy the panoramic views from Scandal Point.

happeningEvents.description: A colorful festival showcasing folk music, dance performances, local handicrafts, and flower exhibitions.
One of the oldest ice skating carnivals in Asia, held at the natural ice rink in Shimla.

destinations.name: Srinagar
destinations.description: Srinagar, the summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir, is renowned for its breathtaking natural beauty, including Dal Lake, Mughal gardens, and snow-capped mountains. It offers serene houseboat stays and a peaceful atmosphere.
popularActivities: Visiting Mughal Gardens (Shalimar Bagh, Nishat Bagh)
travelTips: Experience staying in a houseboat on Dal Lake.
Buy Pashmina shawls and local spices as souvenirs.

happeningEvents.description: A vibrant festival held in Indira Gandhi Memorial Tulip Garden, showcasing a wide variety of tulips in full bloom.
A celebration of the traditional Shikara boats with cultural events, handicraft displays, and boat races on Dal Lake.

destinations.name: Munnar
destinations.description: Munnar, located in the Western Ghats of Kerala, is a picturesque hill station known for its lush tea gardens, misty mountains, and serene atmosphere. It's a paradise for nature lovers and adventure seekers.
travelTips: Pack warm clothing for chilly evenings.
Taste freshly brewed tea at local tea factories.
Enjoy the panoramic views from Top Station.

happeningEvents.description: A rare natural phenomenon where the Neelakurinji flowers bloom, covering the hills in vibrant shades of blue and purple.
A colorful event showcasing a variety of flowers, including rare orchids and blooming hybrids, attracting nature enthusiasts and gardeners.

destinations.name: Chennai
destinations.description: Chennai, the capital city of Tamil Nadu, is a bustling metropolis known for its rich heritage, vibrant arts scene, classical music and dance, and delectable cuisine. It's a blend of tradition and modernity.
travelTips: Stay hydrated due to the hot climate.
Try traditional Tamil dishes like Dosa and Sambar.
Attend classical music and dance performances at cultural centers.

happeningEvents.description: A month-long festival featuring classical music and dance concerts, attracting renowned artists and enthusiasts from around the world.
The harvest festival of Tamil Nadu celebrated with traditional rituals, cooking of Pongal dish, and cultural events.
